And neither cages, nor the rack or the iron maidens offer people brought into this room for questioning any promise of safety or release, no matter if they answer the question posed to them fast or not.

148366.name: Scriptorium
148366.description:
From the Introduction:

Stale air, smelling of old parchment, mold and dust is the first thing assaulting the senses of anyone entering this room through one of its two gates. The next thing that becomes obvious are the numerous shelves, heaped with even more numerous scrolls, spanning between the columns supporting the ceiling. A number of lamps mounted on some of these columns provide a little illumination. Anything but the center of this scriptorium remains in a twilight though. Especially in the dimly lit space surrounded by shelves and columns one has to take care not to stumble over heaps of heavy tomes. In the well lit center two heavy wooden table serve as a rudimentary working space, where scribes study and sometimes copy the contents of this little library.

148367.description:
Special Ops Issue #4 includes

ASL/ASLSK articles:
· Into the Land of the Rising Sun by Chas Argent
· Exit...Stage Right! by Daniel M. Preston

ASL scenarios:
· O7 Broken Wings (Pete Shelling)
· O8 Crucifix Hill (Pete Shelling)

ASLSK scenarios:
· S54 Operation Natzmer (Joe Gochinski)
· S55 The Fire Brigade (Joe Gochinski)

Scenarios for "It never snows":
· 5.9 The Red Devils & The Free Poles
· 5.10 All Americans
· 5.11 Screaming Eagles
· 5.12 The Guards

The magazine also contains the game What Price Glory? and articles on MMP's other game lines.
148367.name: Special Ops Issue #4

148368.name: The Manor (Issue 1 - May 2012)
148368.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manor is a jammed packed, Old School zine. Inside you'll find a stink'n old salt pit with one of my favorite creatures, a d12 table from the mischevious mind of Jason Sholtis, one of the many secrets of Rural Pennsylvania, a poetry slam by an old time blogging favorite Rusty Battle Axe, a table of random forest encounters and a boot merchant with a bad, bad past.

148369.name: The Manor (Issue 2 - Jul 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Strange Things You Might Find Under The Cot At Smugglers Inn
148369.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #2 comes out swinging with a fully realized shop, Hugo's Healing Potions, that can be dropped into any fantasy campaign. Maps, personalities, adventure hooks and even a random customer table. The second half is dedicated to a versitile site, Snugglers Inn. It can be used as a reoccuring place of operations or used as an adventure.

This zine is for old school way of thinking or more importantly just having fun. So grab a copy, see if you can get Hugo to crack a smile then if you dare, travel across Ten Killer Lake and get into a game of chance with Halla. Beware of what you gamble. What you lose on the table may be the least of your worries.

148370.name: The Manor (Issue 3 - Feb 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Adzeer: God of the Monster Hunt
One-Shot Adventure: Mine of Rot & Disease
Poetry Slam: Black Dragon - A Haiku
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
148370.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manor is back with more old school gaming goodies. Within these pages you'll find:

The Village of Aberton is suffering from a mysterious sickness. Undead have been spotted on the dark countryside. The Baron has not responded. The monks of Ambrose Abbey seemed to have abandon Aberton. Only a group a kick ass adventurers can cure this disease.

Pog Nog strolls through the streets with his creaky wheeled cart. He's got a surprising selection of trinkets. He's got stuff you don't even know you need, but he'll make sure the right item gets the right person.

And the Monster Hunter class. This class was created for the Blood & Treasure RPG, but can kill monsters in any edition of any game...ever.

148371.name: The Manor (Issue 4 - Jul 2013)
148371.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the biggest Manor yet and more artwork packed into this issue than the first three combined.

This first hald is an adventure, Incident at Butch Creek. The party is asked to assist the Hamlet of Low Ridge to rid the area of a few dangerous predators. But there is something not quite right. There is more to this adventure. A secret. A dangerous secret that could kill them all.

The second half is From Beneath the Manor, a mini collection of horrible creatures to populate your game. These creatures have crawled out of the mind of long time gamers and brought to life by the deft hand of Jason Sholtis.

148372.name: Curse of the Assassin
148372.description:
Curse of the Assassin is written and designed by S.P. Osborne, author of GA1, and takes you back to the familiar surrounds of Orlandes City where you pick up your life some time after the events in An Assassin in Orlandes. You’ve risen through society after dealing with Eltane and saving the city, capturing the affections of the Duke’s daughter along the way. The mysterious death of a friend arouses your suspicions and once again you find yourself at the heart of conspiracy that takes you back to your home village and a meeting with your old adventuring party from your youth.

An exciting mystery adventure thriller races from Orlandes City through to the wilds of Orlandes, into the mines of Kern Badenach and even out to sea! Pirkka Harvala, who previously illustrated An Assassin in Orlandes and Catacombs of the Undercity, returns for his third gamebook and this time his wonderful artwork appears in colour for the first time!

• Includes all the interactive reading and gameplay features found in the previous Gamebook Adventures titles.
• Read the story and dictate the direction of the story! Options based on who you have met, where you have visited and what you have found.
• Unique battle system using realistic 3D dice which can be rolled by shaking your smartphone or tablet.
• Lots of achievements to collect and artwork to find throughout the book. These are placed on your achievement wall.
• Three difficulty levels. Read the book casually by being able to move around freely or crank up the difficulty and be a hardcore gamebook player.
• Companions you meet on the adventure will now fight with you!
• Awesome artwork (including a new cover by Dan Maxwell!) and music by Adrian Watkins to accompany the interactive story.

Source: The Game Website.

148373.name: Boson X
148373.description:
Quantum jump from planck to planck as you hit critical velocity in Boson X, a new rotational runner from Mu & Heyo.

Build up speed inside a massive particle accelerator and generate high-energy collisions to discover strange new particles. Use precise timing and fast reflexes to navigate a subatomic world where floors and ceilings don't exist. Will you be fast enough to find the elusive Boson X?

Boson X is available for PC, Mac and Linux as a free download, or for iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch as a paid app.

Source: The Game Website.

148375.description:
Join in the valiant battle to end the ultimate stalemate of good vs. evil and etch the final outcome into history. Regnum Angelica is a two-player strategic card/board game pitting Gabriel and his army of archangels against Beelzebub and the dark forces of the fallen. Wield the three elements of fire, earth and water in angelic combat, use ancient angelic scripts to gain an advantage over your opponent, or deploy pillars to protect your troops in an attempt to infiltrate the enemy's realm.

Regnum Angelica is played with one player having the white deck to represent the archangels of Gabriel, and the other the black deck to represent Beelzebub and his army of fallen angels. Each deck consists of three types of cards: Angels, which are your main combat units; Angelic Scripts, written in the ancient celestial alphabet (Malachim) and granting the angels special abilities to assist them in infiltrating the enemy realm; and Pillars, which call up the elements of earth, fire, or water to protect them from enemy attacks.

Each army has a power meter which is charged when either side's angels visit earth. The power meter must be carefully managed if you hope to crush your opponent as your power meter determines your movement and your ability to execute the Malachim. If too many Angelic scripts are played, then your mobility on the board suffers; if, on the other hand, you use your power for movement, then your ability to harness the powers of the angelic scripts wanes.

Mobility or Angelic Scripts? Have your angels protect your realm, or go on the full offensive to penetrate your enemies kingdom? Execute your scripts now, burn them for precious power, or save them to use with other scripts to pull off powerful combinations? Many of these tactical decisions await you as you control the most powerful beings in the universe of Regnum Angelica!
148375.name: Regnum Angelica
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28: Every Picture Tells a Story
Dice Tower News 219 - February 14, 2014
The Board Game Review Room: Kingdom

148376.description:
Epic Picnic is a fast and crazy card game inspired by a verbal memory game from childhood, corrupted with humor from adult life (ages 17+!). You might bring figgy pudding on a picnic, fashion a makeshift weapon out of Peter Piper's pickled pecker, or inherit a Nicaraguan death squad from your grandfather.

Best of all, it's super easy to pick up and play!

Players reveal cards from a common deck to represent the ridiculous and terrible things they are bringing on the picnic (or one of 9 other scenarios) while at the same time trying to stay focused and remember what everyone else is bringing in order. Miss just one card and you're out of the game in this last-man-standing, brain-hemorrhaging face-off!

The rules also contain several variations and plus an alternate method of play -- Picnic Frenzy -- where players recite just one card per turn, making for much faster gameplay. Played in rounds and featuring 5 second turns, it is perhaps even more challenging than the original!
148376.name: Epic Picnic
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Party Gamecast Reviews - Epic Picnic - Slightly Less PG than normal

148377.name: Cosmos
148377.description:
In Cosmos, players take turns exploring the universe, building far-flung colonies, and collecting taxes (for once, we're on the right side of taxes!). The goal of the game is to make the most money from the economic opportunities of exploring space, while elbowing out the market competition. Central market mechanics allow players to compete by increasing or decreasing universal resource prices, while limited resources make each region of space a hotly-contested competition for colonies. The game ends when the universe is totally explored--meaning if you're sitting in dead last without a hope, you can explore your heart out and rush the game to an untimely conclusion.

Cosmos is very straightforward to learn, and a typical game takes around 30-45 minutes. Cosmos is simple enough for casual gamers to play (and win), but complex enough to keep the interest of more competitive or experienced gamers. Turns are quick, and the game mechanics are easy to remember.

Most conflict in Cosmos is indirect, making this a great game for two players--even those who may be mismatched in competitive nature or gaming experience (read: the hobbyist and the spouse). At the same time, Cosmos allows up to eight players, making it a decent party game, although it gets a bit crowded and far more competitive at six.

Overall, this is a highly replayable, very entertaining game with a really broad appeal and low commitment requirements.

148378.description: World of Tanks: Rush — AMX 12t, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light French tank that costs 1, gives 1 resource, and has no special ability.
148378.name: World of Tanks: Rush – AMX 12t

148379.name: IconGame
148379.description:
IconGame
Do you know how you say "pencil" in Spanish? And "rubber"? And "sharpener"? Learn all these words and many more with IconGame.
It's easy: You choose a card, and if you know how to say it correctly in Spanish, you win the corresponding Picnics (points) according to their degree of difficulty. At the end of the game, the player who accumulates more Picnics wins.

Includes 50 vocabulary cards (with pronunciation guide) and plastic sandwich.




IconGame
¿Sabes cómo se dice “lápiz” en inglés? ¿Y “goma”? ¿Y “sacapuntas”? Aprende todas estas palabras y muchas más con IconGame.
Es muy fácil: Eliges una tarjeta, y si sabes cómo se dice correctamente en inglés ganas los Picnics (puntos) correspondientes, según su grado de dificultad. Al final de la partida, gana el jugador que más Picnics acumula.

Incluye 50 cartas de vocabulario (con guía de pronunciación) y sandwichera de plástico.

148380.name: Bicycle Race
148380.description:
Bicycle Race is a fast-playing 18-card microgame of bluff and luck for 4–6 players, from designer Sebastian Bleasdale.

You’re a cyclist competing for position in the peloton, but overtaking the leaders isn’t easy. You’ll need skill in bluffing and a healthy dose of luck. Can you out-think the other riders and reach the head of the pack in time to seize victory?

148381.description:
How do you feel if you win the lottery? What if someone rejects you?

Playing with emotions has never been so much fun as in Ikonikus, a.k.a. icon'tact. In the game, a player raises an issue and the others must choose which of their cards best represents that emotion. Each card represents an emotion with multiple readings.

•••

Jugar con las emociones nunca ha sido tan divertido
¿Cómo te sientes si te toca la lotería?
¿Y si alguien te rechaza?
Jugar a Ikonikus es muy fácil: Un jugador plantea una cuestión y el resto debe elegir cuál de sus cartas representa mejor esa emoción. Cada carta representa una emoción con múltiples lecturas.
148381.name: Ikonikus
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET85: Sherlock Holmes y dos muertes en lo alto del K2
RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

148382.name: GeoPicnic
148382.description:
GeoPicnic
Do you know what is the name of this province? And the name of the capital?
Have fun learning and practicing spanish geography. And win 10 Picnics (points) for each correct answer.

Includes 52 cards, a plastic sandwich box, and "Picnic" tickets.




GeoPicnic
¿Sabes cuál es esta provincia? ¿Y su capital? ¿Y la comunidad autónoma a la que pertenece?
Diviértete aprendiendo y practicando un poco de geografía de España. Y gana 10 Picnics (puntos) por cada respuesta acertada.

Incluye 52 cartas, sandwichera de plástico y pack de billetes Picnics.

148383.name: Matematikus
148383.description:
Matematikus
Math can be fun and here's the proof. How many combinations can you make with your 8 cards? And which is the best considering that addition and subtraction are worth 10 Picnics (points) and the multiplications and divisions are worth 20 Picnics? Also consider that the cards have a number on one side and a mathematical sign in the other, and you can only use one of them. You will see that it is quite a challenge.

Matematikus
Las matemáticas pueden ser muy divertidas y aquí está la prueba. ¿Cuántas combinaciones matemáticas puedes formar con tus 8 cartas? ¿Y cuál es la mejor teniendo en cuenta que las sumas y restas valen 10 Picnics (puntos) y las multiplicaciones y divisiones valen 20 Picnics? Ten en cuenta también que las cartas tienen una cifra en una cara y un signo matemático en la otra, y que sólo puedes usar una de ellas. Verás que es todo un reto.

148384.name: Dreams of the Lurid Sac
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148384.description:
From the publisher's website:

"About"? "About"? This module is not "about" anything. It is the purest location-based module I've ever seen. Not one word is about anything other than the titular Lurid Sac. That's your location.

Confused? Think about where Han Solo flew the Millennium Falcon in The Empire Strikes Back. Or, more precisely, into what he flew it. The Lurid Sac is freaking alive! The whole damn dungeon is one giant monster. And what a monster! The Lurid Sac is nothing less than the most amazing monster ever published for D&D. I can't tell you how cool the whole thing is. Summaries fail Dreams of the Lurid Sac, which is tightly and precisely written. It's weird that Paul was able to use such exacting language to describe something so fantastic, so outre, so crazy. He has raised the bar with this one. I think it one of the single best (and certainly one of the most imaginative) modules I've ever seen.

148385.name: PLYT
148385.description:
Plyt is a great new family board game for players of ALL ages and abilities to play together in a fun, competitive and challenging way and, even better, it improves your numeracy skills!

The game is easy to play and works around multiplying a number of 12 sided dice together within the agreed time, negotiating the Plyt squares and racing against each other to be the first to reach the winner square. But there’s a balance of risk and reward. Plyters decide how many dice to throw to try and get ahead, and when it comes to it, who they will push back or help. It starts off gently to let you get the feel of it but as the play gets closer to the end, positions can change quickly and the result isn’t certain until the very last throw!

But Plyt isn’t just about beating your opponents – it’s also about challenging yourself – pushing yourself out of your comfort zone and feeling the buzz of getting it right!
There are lots of different playing options you can choose (all described in the rules and on the website) – it all depends how competitive you want the game to be and how long you want it to last. The basic game normally lasts between 25-45 minutes but you can make this shorter or longer – it’s up to you!

Come Forth and Multiply!

148386.name: Deck Delver
148386.description:
Deck Delver is a solitaire dungeon crawler type that plays with a small deck. A portion of the cards are dealt face down in a variety of layouts such as "the Pyramid solitaire game", and then players will have a hand of 5 cards which will act as their inventory of potions and other items.

To explore, simply uncover a card that is free. If it is a monster, you need to fight it by playing a card from your hand, adding the bonus to beat at least 2 of its 3 stats. Once a monster beaten, it goes to your discard pile which in turn increases your inventory like a deck building game. On the other hand, if you miss then you remove cards from the top of your deck.

If your deck runs out its game over. The goal of the game is to reach the dungeon's boss and beat it to reclaim an artifact to become stronger for your next dungeon. In the rule book is included 8 different layouts you can set up the game.

Full color heavy ink version may be found in the link section since the file is too large to upload.

Rules have been updated to V1.3

There is an Expansion currently in the Alpha stage to include a multiplayer co-op rules and new cards too see details below

148387.name: Molds, Slimes, and Fungi
148387.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mythic monstrous manual of the foulest fungus!

The second volume in our new Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Molds, Slimes, and Fungi brings you a dozen and one pestilential horrors and moldering monstrosities to torment your PCs! Twelve of your favorite fungi are here, updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every fungal creature has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from an mythic ascomoid's puffball avalanche to a mythic fungus queen's battle pods and a mythic mu spore's unstoppable titan. From the vicious vegepygmy to the virulent violet fungus, the seductive fungus queen to the colossal corruption of the mu spore, this product covers CRs from 1 to 26. In addition to a dozen familiar fungal monsters, Mythic Monsters: Molds, Slimes, and Fungi also includes rules for the fungal creature subtype as well as eight mythic fungal hazards, from the familiar green slime and yellow mold to shriekers and azure fungus! To top it all off, Mythic Monsters: Molds, Slimes, and Fungi introduces an entirely new 13th mythic fungal creature, the sublime and mysterious fairy ring, a living portal into the realms of the fey that can be a boon or bane to weary and lost travelers.

The Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games brings you dynamic and exciting mechanics alongside evocative and cinematic new abilities that really help creatures live up to their flavor text, whether they are creatures of real-world myth and legend or creatures born out of the RPG tradition itself. These creatures can work just as well in a non-mythic campaign as they do in one that incorporates the full mythic rules, as you can throw them at your jaded players who think they’ve seen it all or know the standard monster stats as well as you do. That look of surprise and “What was THAT?” will warm any GM’s heart.

148388.name: Exotic Encounters: Vargouilles
148388.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the vargouille. These strange bodiless fiends date back to the first edition Monster Manual II, and are one of the stranger creatures of the lower planes, feared far and wide for their deadly kiss, which provides a very unforgiving “save or die” experience at a very low level, a terrible fate that is only compounded by the fact that the transformation is detailed in particularly macabre fashion as the character’s hair falls out and their facial features slowly twist over the course of one or more days. The first vargouille in this book, the singing vargouille (CR 3) can also cause such a transformation, though in this case, it is done by a haunting lullaby, instead. Singing vargouilles can also unleash powerful and damaging sonic shrieks, and their bite inflicts a curse of silence. These terrors pale before the bloodsucking vargouille (CR 5) however, which does not kiss its victims but instead attaches to them and drains their blood, transforming their victims into wights, whose heads separate from their bodies and become vargouilles when they are destroyed. Finally, the giant vargouille (CR 7) is a vargouille of titanic proportions, with a propensity for swooping down and swallowing human prey whole in a single gulp, and either allowing them to be digested by powerful acid that inflicts difficult-to-heal wounds, or simply spitting them back out again in the air, leaving the victim to fall to his doom.

148389.name: The Temple of the Red God
148389.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Pulp: Hard-boiled detectives, fedora-wearing action heroes, and Steampunk gadgeteers rocketing to battle with their jet packs against bloodthirsty Thule cultists of the Third Reich."

Tens of thousands of years before our time, in the mythic Thurian Age, the cult of the Red God, the Blood Imperator, spread across the world like a plague, its legions more powerful than the Aztecs and more cultured than the Mayans. Now, so many eons later, a temple has been unearthed deep in the jungle--a temple built by a lost civilization and dedicated to this long-forgotten god.

Is it possible that the Red God itself still sits at the heart of the temple, now decrepit, crumbling, and suffering from thousands of years of neglect? What secrets of ancient knowledge still reside within, undiscovered and little-touched by the millennia that have quietly passed it by? What treasures may still be hidden behind the stones and beneath the altars of the place? Perhaps even the very bible of the cult itself, an unprecedented find of historical significance! There's only one way to find out, and that's what you do best...

148390.name: The Day After Ragnarok (Fate Core Edition)
148390.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is the hit new rules system Fate Core more your cup of tea? Well, the vast vistas of the world after Serpentfall are now available to you too! Fate Core lead designer Leonard Balsera adapts Kenneth Hite’s award winning dieselpunk works of savagery and sorcery! With this book in hand, you’ll be able to forge your own Fate Core campaigns in the shadow of the Midgard Serpent’s rotting corpse, or even use The Day After Ragnarok as an alternate timeline-gone-wrong backstory for your Shadow of the Century game!

The Day After Ragnarok – Fate Core Edition includes:

Four campaign frameworks, and guidelines on how to structure your Fate Core campaign in the ruins of the world after Serpentfall.
Complete rules and guidelines for creating a hero suited for these dark times, including character archetypes and brand new advice on choosing setting-appropriate aspects!
Dangerous ophi-tech devices built with knowledge torn from the Thing that nearly killed the world: fiber bombs, Marconi pistols, jet-packs, and more!
A grand tour through the post-apocalyptic world of 1948, from the drowned East Coast to the Soviet empire behind the Serpent Curtain—including the Top Five Places to Be Attacked By Pirates, the Top Five Places to Find A Remote Castle Ruled By A Madman, and much more!
Stats for more than thirty foes to shoot, stab, or sneak past: Serpent cultists, Spetsnaz troopers, swamp devils, and … snakes! Giant, 80-foot long snakes, that is!
Over 20 pages of pure adventure: Four campaign types, each with a sample campaign laid out in nine scenario seeds.
A massive Adventure Generator, helping you build every tale from the Hook to the Henchmen to the Twist ending! Plus old-school encounters for the devastated wastelands of America—will you face slave-raiding Klansmen, the terrifying fly-by-night, or a desperate band of escaped Wehrmacht P.O.W.s?
The tragic tale of how the Century Club went down fighting the Midgard Serpent. Learn how Jet Black flew the atomic bomb into the Serpent’s mouth to end the fight, and read the sad and tragic tale of Sally Slick, the sole survivor of the battle who now wanders the wastelands of America, keeping the spirit of the century alive for just one more day.

148401.name: Novapuls (NordCon 2009 Special Issue - 06-06-2071)
148401.description: Released as support for official demo plays at NordCon 2009.

148402.name: Novapuls (NordCon 2011 Special Issue 1/2 - 06-04-2073)
148402.description: Released as support for official demo plays at NordCon 2011.

148403.name: Novapuls (NordCon 2011 Special Issue 2/2 - 06-05-2073)
148403.description: Released as support for official demo plays at NordCon 2011.

148404.name: GURPS Martial Arts: Technical Grappling
148404.description:
Master Grappling . . . or Face Defeat!

The canny warrior knows that grappling is fundamental to fighting. Any melee – from a brawl to a swordfight – could suddenly move into the clinch. Some fighters even specialize in such tactics!

This is a hard subject to get a hold on, however; volumes have been written about leverage alone. GURPS Martial Arts: Technical Grappling brings this depth to GURPS. Expansions to the GURPS Basic Set and GURPS Martial Arts rules include:


Trained Strength. Discover how technical proficiency complements raw power.
Control Points. Transform grappling from an all-or-nothing affair to a matter of degree.
Position Revisited. Achieve leverage by jockeying for not only posture, but also facing and orientation.
Armed Grappling. Control and entangle your foes with a surprising variety of melee weapons.
Combat Options. Narrow your focus with the One Foe option, exploit Committed Attack to force a posture change, pass a limb to trap your opponent, and more.
Techniques. More than 30 of them – some new, some modified. Use an Escaping Parry to break a clinch, or Change Position to establish a weight advantage.
Fighting Styles. Learn Jacket Wrestling or Shuai Jiao – and distinguish between between bear and lion attacks – with six classic styles plus four specifically for animals.


Whether your campaign features athletes wrestling for prizes and honor, lawmen who must control and disarm suspects, or historical warriors trained to fight to the death, Martial Arts: Technical Grappling will add detail and realism to your battles.

This supplement requires GURPS Martial Arts for GURPS Fourth Edition.

148405.name: Lord of Arcana
148405.description:
Lord of Arcana takes place in a world called Horodyn, named after the land's first king. Somewhere in Horodyn lies an ancient stone known only as "Arcana", which apparently holds great magical power. Unfortunately, as well as humans, the world is home to many great and powerful monsters and beasts, which are fought by warriors known as Slayers who seek Arcana.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lord of Arcana", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148406.name: Warriors of the Lost Empire
148406.description:
From the Box

A Fantasy, Action RPG with customisable characters, each with their own skills and abilities. Uncover the truth behind the rise and fall of the once great city of Antinopolis.

148407.name: Hot Pixel
148407.description:
From the box

Meg instant fun on your PSP
200+ Energized Mini-Games for instant fun inspired by Atari Classics and Street Cultures Connect to hotpxl.com and get extra content Challenge your friends in Multiplayer

148408.name: Public Playtest Package (2013-09-19)
rpg: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)
148408.description:
user summary

Final public release of playtest materials for DnDNext/5e version of Dungeons and Dragons.

148409.name: Gradius Collection
148409.description:
From the Box

20 years of intense shooting action!

A shooting fan's dream come true! Gradius collection assembles 5 classic titles from the Gradius series I, II, III, IV, and the long awaited Gradius Gaiden!

148410.name: The Shrine of Olikulese
148410.description:
Back cover blurb:
There are rumors of an ancient shrine in the hills just outside of Broken Bow, a shrine that holds potent and dangerous secrets. Will you be able to unlock the mysteries hidden away in the hills, or will you fall victim to the evil that has settled there? Find out as you play through the Shrine of Olikulese.

Designer's blurb:
Written by Bryan Meadows with illustrations by Carolyn Meadows and a map by myself, this is CMG's first delve into the world of Fate Accelerated Edition (FAE) and adventure! This short adventure is a great introduction to the world of FAE and the excellent game system that it is. After Bryan, Alex and I joined a game ran by the author, Bryan and I knew we had to make an adventure for the system to help encourage people to take a look at FAE.

148411.name: GP32
148411.description:
The overall design is not unlike the original version of the Game Boy Advance. The GP32 is based on a 133 MHz ARM CPU and 8 MB of RAM. Unlike other hand held gaming systems, which tend to be proprietary cartridge-based, the GP32 uses SmartMedia cards (SMC) for storing programs and data, making it accessible for amateur developers as no further development hardware is required.

The console has a four-way mini-joystick controller, two main buttons ('A' and 'B'), two shoulder buttons on each side of the SMC slot ('L' and 'R') and two other menu buttons on each side of the screen ('SELECT' and 'START'), made from a softer, translucent rubber. The console also has a USB 1.1 port for connection with a host computer, a serial expansion port, a 3.3 V power adapter input, a headphone connector and a rear compartment which holds two AA sized batteries.

Source: Wikipedia, "GP32", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148412.name: Star Wars: Battlefront – Elite Squadron
148412.description:
Elite Squadron allows players to participate in combat on foot, in ground vehicles or in space. Players are also able to enter capital ships and, once the shields are down, fight the enemy inside on foot. The ground-space transitions are accompanied by short cut-scenes while the game loads the next area. The same is also true of entering or exiting a capital ship. This is the first Battlefront game to allow players to fly from ground to space battles. The consequences of each battle will depend on the players actions, meaning that each individual enemy killed can affect the outcome of a result. The battlefront will not be one giant, seamless map, but a compilation of inter-connected, smaller size areas, each one capable of affecting the other.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148413.name: Body Builders: A Tale of Taxidermy
148413.description: In the light strategy game Body Builders, 3-6 players assume the role of lonely taxidermists who recruit vultures, hyenas, crocodiles and other critters to scavenge for animal parts that can be combined to build themselves a friend. Players recruit these scavengers with dice through a combination of choice and chance, and they use this army of scavengers to invade opposing taxidermists to try to steal the parts they need to complete their new pal and thus win the game.

148414.name: The Hidden Tomb of Slaggoth the Necromancer
148414.description:
From the introduction:
Mentioning the name of Slaggoth the Necromancer was once met with hastily gestured holy signs and murmurs of fear. The dead things which crawled and slithered from Slaggoth’s hidden tower were ravenous and evil. In the two centuries since the necromancer’s body was entombed deep within a mountain cave, the name has lost some of its gravitas. Young adventurers, unperturbed by ancient tales of long past evil, now think Slaggoth’s tomb ripe for plunder.

But Slaggoth does not rest alone. A trio of ogres and their hoard of goblin minions have settled in the caverns. They are deserters from a great army in a faraway land, and are determined to keep the freedom they risked their lives to gain. Any who enter the cavern will be sliced and stabbed, their meat hung on hooks to dry, and their bones fed to the wolves.

148415.name: Diddly
148415.description:
From Publisher Information

Diddly

The Game of squat!

In this card game less is better, but Diddly is best. On a turn, draw a card to replace a card. Match cards to make them worth Diddly. There’s Nothing to it! But wait, there’s more! (Or is it less?) Special cards let you peek at your face-down cards, dig through the discard pile, swap your cards, or halve the value of a card. Look Ma, no hands!! Cards are played in front of a player not held in a hand.

Diddly is an easy and addictive game for children and adults. To win Diddly, stop at nothing… or as close as you can!

Ages: 6 and Up

148416.name: Monster Math
148416.description:
Game Information:
This game is intended for 2-6 players, ages 7 and up, preferably with an adult. Calculators can be a helpful tool and are allowed to be incorporated for use. A game should take 30-45 minutes from start to finish.
Players take turns playing out their hands of numbers and sign cards to get their totals as close to the randomly selected red target number card.

Object:
The first player to win five or more red target cards is the winner.

Monster Math cards are some of the best learning aids for mathematics, as opposed to flash cards which have a suggested problem preformed on the card. Monster Math allows the tutor to rearrange the numbers and signs so that the student can see how they would interact in real time. By simply moving a number from the bottom of the equation to the top, the student would get to experience and make the connections themselves as to how the math interacts with the numbers and signs, and the tutor can demonstrate the relationship of numbers and signs with proficiency so that the student could repeat the process for themselves.

148417.name: Romans vs Britons
148417.description: Romans vs Britons plays out an ambush of a small troop of Roman soldiers marching along a Roman road sometime in the mid first century AD. They are in a valley when they spot fearsome Britons coming down from the surrounding hills. Orthogonal movement and custodial capture Captains (2 each) can capture more that one enemy. Three different levels of win depending on whether the loser manages to escape, surrender or is entirely defeated. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148418.name: The Defence of Pictland
148418.description: The Defence of Pictland plays out a battle between Northumbrian warriors aiming to expand their Kingdom northwards into Pictland in the seventh century. The Picts however are more than ready to defend their land and meet up with their enemy in a boggy valley. Movement and capture differ on dry land (knight's move and replacement) and in the bog (orthogonal and custodial). Winner captures all opposing men. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148419.name: Vikings vs Saxons
148419.description: Vikings vs Saxons plays out a skirmish between the Saxon settlers of dark age Britain and incoming Vikings some time in the 8th century. They meet at a bridge and fight to the death. There are three categories of men: Swords-men (movement: ortho/diag 3/2 squares); Axe-men (movement: ortho/diag 2/1 squares); Spear-men (movement: knights move). Two levels of winning depending on whether the loser surrenders/escapes or is entirely defeated. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148420.name: War in the Welsh Marches
148420.description:
War in the Welsh Marches represents a battle between a Marches Lord and Welsh Raiders on land between two castles in the frontier territory of the borderlands between England and Wales in the 12th century. Movement orthogonal; capture by short leap. Aim to capture the opposing captain or to enter three men into the opposing castle square.
Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148421.name: Royalists vs Roundheads
148421.description: Royalists vs Roundheads represents a battle in the first few years of the Civil Wars of the 17th century. Royalists and Roundheads line up their Cavaliers, Pikemen and Musketeers and the battle begins. Three types of men each with different movement: Pikemen (movement: ortho/diag forwards only 1 square, capture by replacement); Musketeers (movement: ortho/diag 3/2, capture by replacement); Cavaliers (movement: ortho/diag 1 square, capture by long leap). Aim to capture opposing general ( a Cavalier). Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148422.name: Tudor Galleons at War
148422.description: Tudor Galleons at War represents a sea battle between old enemies, England and France, at the beginning of modern naval warfare in the Tudor period. Three classes of ship each with differing degrees of orthogonal and diagonal movement. Capture is custodial but depends on the size of the ships capturing and the ship being captured. Winner is the player with the most points in the navy that survives the battle. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

148423.name: Tomb Robbers and Temple Raiders
148423.description: Tomb Robbers and Temple Raiders plays out a clash between two groups of treasure hunting robbers and raiders amongst the temple ruins of Egypt in the 1920s. All men on both sides move by the knight's move (x1 or x2) and capture by alignment. Secret passages allow an extra degree of movement across the board. Two levels of win depending on whether the losing side can allow their last man to escape or is defeated entirely. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Tric Trac Nominee
148424.description:
Players in 30 Carats start with exactly the same items — a colored screen to hide their goods, five gemstones of each color in play, and five gold nuggets — but they won't stay the same for long! After all, each player receives a secret valuation card, ranging from +30 to -30, and the gemstones matching the color of his screen will have this value at the end of the game. (Gold nuggets are always +10 points.) Do you need to sell or buy your initial holdings? And how do you find out the value of everything else?!

Each player also starts the game with three transaction cards. Each transaction lists a minimum offer that a seller must make on his turn, e.g., at least two gems of his own color or one gem of his color and two gems of a neighbor's color.

The game lasts three rounds, labeled morning, midday and night. In each round, each player will be the seller once. The player chooses one of his transaction cards, then places an offer onto the table that at least matches the minimum offer required. If the transaction is labeled "simultaneous", each other player must simultaneously reveal an offer of his own, which must include at least one stone/nugget and must not match the seller's offer; if the transaction is "successively", each opponent reveals his offer in clockwise order. After seeing all of the offers, the seller either trades goods with an opponent or pays 2-4 nuggets to the bank in order to drop his offer into the bank bag (along with his nuggets), then draw that many items from the bag. (The bank bag starts with the same items as each player.)

In games with at least four players, the seller can pay 2-4 gold nuggets to the bank in order to look at the secret valuation card held by any opponent.

Once each player has been seller three times, the game ends and everyone reveals their valuation cards. Players then tally their scores, and the player with the highest total wins, with gold nuggets in hand breaking ties.
148424.name: 30 Carats
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ36: 30 Carats (2013) Fabien Chevillon

148425.name: Lie Your Face Off!: Your Go-To Lies
148425.description:
A mini-expansion to Lie Your Face Off! These are the lies that have always gotten you out of tricky situations, even when you were a baby.

If you don't have a Go-To Lie in you hand and you have to draw a card, you draw a Go-To Lie. Playing a Go-To Lie will always make you draw another one. These lies are more powerful than their base game counterparts, but if either the base game or the expansion deck runs out of cards, the game ends. Additionally, you'll need to complete another story for every expansion deck that you are using to end the game.

148426.name: 18 giugno 1815: Waterloo
148426.description:
The game is a hex and counter simulation of the battle of Waterloo, for two opponents and two possible difficulty levels.

The counters represent all the units that actually took part into the battle. A unit is normally at regimental level.

Game length is between 10 and 12 turns. Each turn corresponds to 60 minutes of real time.

Victory is calculated according to points gained for fulfilled objectives minus points lost following the elimination of the gamer's own units.

148427.name: K-Day: Kaiju War!
148427.description:
K-Day: Kaiju War! is an action point allowance system solo dice game. You will need a print out of the game sheet, 11 6-sided dice (6 in 1 color, 5 in another color) and tokens to represent the kaijus (giant monsters). You play Zillasaur, a kaiju on a rampage to wreck havoc in Japan. Getting in your way are pesky human defense force and Guardian Kaijus that emerge to roam and protect the land.

To win the game, Zillasaur needs to score 300 victory points by destroying cities and battling the Guardian Kaijus, and stay alive at the end of 14 days. At the start of each day, Zillasaur has 4 action points to either move, attack cities, gain hit points or engage in a Kaiju Battle using various modes of dice roll.

Will you be able to survive the tank onslaughts, deluge of air strikes, and ferocious kaiju-on-kaiju battles?

148428.name: La Battaglia del Lago Ghiacciato
148428.description:
The game is based on the battle of Lake Peipus (1242) as inspired by Sergej Ejzenstejn's movie "Alexandr Nevskij".

The map is divided into squares and the units are beautiful stand-up paper soldiers (that the players have to cut and mount) designed by Guido Crepax, representing Russians and Teutonic knights.

Victory is gained when a certain difference between players' points is reached or, alternatively, with the elimination of one of the two armies. Points are assigned according to the quality and the quantity of eliminated enemy units.

148429.name: Im Schatten des Elfenbeinturms
148429.description:
from the back of the book

Since centuries, the ivory tower (Elfenbeinturm) is the symbol of the magic elite of Aventurien. Until her tragic accident Prishya of Grangor was at the top of its highest battlements, but today the once prestigious Mage is now a shadow of her former self, trying desperately to restore her old reputation among mages by plunging deeply into research. However, to clarify the last mysteries of the enigmatic fragments, that were recovered from Fremmelshofen, being plunged for centuries into the intermediate world of Limbo, Prishya needs the help of energetic specialists.

While the mage guilds prepare for the All-Aventurian Covenant of Magic in Kuslik, it's up to the heroes to discover ancient documents and forgotten artifacts - but they are not alone! An unidentified adversary wants to exploit the knowledge of the old wizard for his evil purposes, and it is in the hands of the heroes to thwart his evil plans.

The events reach their peak during the St. Basil's Test in which a suitable hero mage can face the probably biggest challenge of his life - the examination to become an Archmage.

148430.description:
In Downtown, the players are gangster bosses and must recruit gangsters, get information about jobs from the stooges, then send their gangsters out to rob. The loot has to be sold to fences or, if the loot is money, the money has to be washed "clean" by a money launderer. The first player to possess 100,000 "clean" dollars wins the game.

There is no fixed order in which the players take their turn. Through his actions, the current player always chooses the next player. When it is your turn, you should always try to choose a player who will probably then choose you again because the more often a player comes to turn, the better the chances for him to win the game. Wise foresight into the plans of the other players will help to make you the winner.

As a two-player game, Downtown works differently.

BEST WITH 4 PLAYERS!!!
148430.name: Downtown
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 468 - Parfum, Downtown, and Fidelitas

148431.name: La oss lære om flagg
148431.description:
Children's educational game about European flags. Players roll two dice with a colour on each face, and must find a tile showing a flag containing the two resulting colours, and then place it on the right space on the map which forms the game board. Each correct match and placement yields a coin; identifying and placing one's own country's flag gives a bonus coin in addition to this. The player who has collected the most coins when all tiles have been placed is the winner.

No upper limit on the number of players is given or implied; at least up to five players seems reasonable.

148432.name: Xi Cards
148432.description:
A fantasy based CCG set in a chinese/medieval universe.

From the Xi Cards website:

"Set in the 'World of Xi', Xi cards lets you battle with four factions and two ancient powers to determine the fate of the planet."
The game uses "time" units as a resource which allows players to draw cards, play spells and save time for future turns.

Players win by reducing their opponents from 40 "life points" to 0.
Xi Cards has four card types, "units", "point spells", "lasting spells" and "statements".

The game is shown and explained as a two player game although the rules say that a multiplayer game is possible.

148434.name: Gormenghast: The Board Game
148434.description:
Mervyn Peake’s extraordinary ‘gothic’ novels, centered on the castle of Gormenghast, have captured the imaginations of millions of readers worldwide, turning the work into a cult classic. The atmosphere of the rambling and decaying castle of Gormenghast with its intrigues, its rituals, its morbid humour and its sheer eccentricity has been a lovingly recreated in this amazing board game.

In this board game each player takes on the role of a ‘kitchen rat’ similar to Steerpike in the books. Like Steerpike you have the same murderous desire for power. Your goal is to accumulate as much influence as you can (in the form of Victory Tokens),
rise to the top and become Master of Ritual. To acquire Victory Tokens players move characters around the board to complete various intrigues (detailed on Plot Cards). When a player completes a plot they gain Victory Tokens. The first player to acquire 9 (or more) Victory Tokens wins the game.

Contents
Rule book
book of ritual
10 x character pieces
30 x castle tiles
three card decks consisting of 106 cards each- 66 action cards, 10 character cards and 30 plot cards
30 x artefact tokens
20 x influence tokens
40 x victory tokens
1 x blocking token
1 x ritual die

148435.name: Jakten på brødrene Dal
148435.description: Exploration game based on the first two Norwegian children's television series about the eponymous "brødrene Dal" (the Dal brothers). Players paddle their canoes around a labyrinthine river, searching for crystals to power time machines needed to travel in time and space to places where the lost Dal brothers might be stuck.

148436.name: Perfekte Verbrechen
148436.description:
publisher blurb

Der gelöste Fall
von Thomas Echelmeyer und Reiner Heep

Die Sängerin Jenny Saphire wurde ermordet. Indizien liegen ausreichend vor, ebenso eine plausible Theorie über den Mörder. Diesen zu finden und zu verhaften, sollte für die Detektive ein Klacks sein. Lobende Schlagzeilen in den Zeitungen sind garantiert und sie könnten sich in dem zu erwartenden Ruhm sonnen, wenn … ja, wenn nicht ein schaler Beigeschmack diese rosigen Zukunftsaussichten trüben würde. Ein Anderer hat nämlich den Fall schon vorher gelöst und schenkt den Detektiven, was sie brauchen, um den Täter dingfest zu machen. Aber nicht alles – schließlich ist da noch eine winzige Kleinigkeit, ein Gefallen, den die Detektive als Gegenleistung erbringen könnten …

A Case Closed
by Thomas Echelmeyer and Reiner Heep
The singer Jenny Saphire was murdered. There is enough evidence and also a feasible theory about the one, who committed the crime. It should be very easy for the detectives to find and to arrest this person. It is guaranteed, that they will be honourably mentioned in the newspapers and they could bask in the expected glory, if ... yes if there wouldn’t be a stale aftertaste that clouds those bright visions of the future. Another person has solved the case before and gives the detectives what they need to detain the culprit. But not everything – because there is a little something, a favour, that the detectives could do as a return service …

Dunkle Geheimnisse in Voleʼs Hollow
von Walter Milani-Müller

Voleʼs Hollow, ein kleines Dorf am Flüsschen Itchen, träumt in der malerischen Landschaft von Hampshire vor sich hin. Gute zwei Stunden von London entfernt geht hier das Leben seinen gemächlichen, geregelten Gang. Und wenn hier eine alte Dame verstirbt, so ist das natürlich bedauerlich, aber auch nicht weiter ungewöhnlich – sterben muss schließlich jeder einmal.
Doch dieses Mal ruft eine Kette von Ungereimtheiten die beste Freundin der Toten und schließlich auch den Dorfpolizisten auf den Plan, so dass dieser die Detektive bittet, das Ableben der alten Lehrerin näher zu untersuchen. Ob hier wirklich was nicht stimmt und was es sonst noch so zu entdecken gibt, überlassen wir den Detektiven.
Besuchen Sie also Voleʼs Hollow – malerisch, idyllisch und voll dunkler Geheimnisse.

Dark Secrets in Vole’s Hollow
by Walter Milani-Müller
Vole’s Hollow, a little village at the river Itchen, is daydreaming in the picturesque countryside of Hampshire. Some two hours away from London, life here goes at a leisurely and well-ordered pace. And it is of cause unfortunate if an old lady dies, but also not unusual – everybody has to die some day.
But this time a chain of inconsistencies calls the best friend of the deceased and in the end also the local constable into action, who asks the detectives to investigate the demise of the old teacher more closely. To determine if there is really something amiss and what else there is to discover, is left to the detectives.
Visit Vole’s Hollow – picturesque, idyllic and full of dark secrets.

148437.name: Stratego: Next Generation
148437.description:
User Summary

Play Stratego, the legendary board game, and use your wit to capture your opponent's flag! Fight against the computer or against a friend using wireless connection!

148438.name: World in Flames
148438.description:
World in Flames is Matrix Games’ computer version of Australian Design Group’s classic board game. Covering both the European and Pacific Theaters of Operations during World War II, World in Flames is global in scope while simulating each branch of service in detail. Land units are corps and army level, supplemented with specialized divisions. Naval units include individual counters for every carrier, battleship, cruiser, and light cruiser in the war. Air units represent groups of 250 to 500 airplanes displayed on screen using 1000+ unique bitmapped images. With 6000+ unique units, 250+ countries, and a global map of 70,200 hexes, World in Flames is the premier World War II grand strategy game.

All 11 scenarios from World in Flames Final Edition are included and they range from the small 5 turn Barbarossa offensive in Russia and the 5 turn Guadalcanal battle in the Pacific, through to the 36 turn Global War campaign which spans all of Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia, the Atlantic, and the Pacific. You can play either the Axis or the Allied side or take the role of one of the 8 major powers. Besides solitaire against yourself and head-to-head, you can play over the Internet. The last two modes of play permit team play with up to 6 players (3 per side).

In addition to the full set of rules from World in Flames, Final Edition, there are 80 optional rules. Under the optional rules section you can choose to include the World in Flames expansion modules: Ships in Flames, Planes in Flames, Carrier Planes in Flames, Cruisers in Flames, Convoys in Flames, and others.

This simulation models national production from conveying raw resources over rail and sea lines to factories for the manufacturing infantry, armor, naval, and air combat units. Because oil was so important during World War II, there are separate optional rules for synthetic oil plants and deployment of oil reserves to the front lines. Game units are represented in both armies and corps, aircraft carriers, naval task forces, and the air groups that took part. Everything you need to re-fight the greatest conflict in history.

Two to six players make the strategic decisions that decide the fate of nations. What forces to produce, where to commit them, when and how? No two games of World in Flames play the same, no strategy is foolproof, any decision may have unforeseen, long-term consequences.

If you want to change the world then World in Flames is for you.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This title does not include an AI player in the initial release. It is designed as a computerized, automated and online multiplayer-capable World in Flames.

From the Publisher / Developer Website

148439.name: Gygax Magazine (Issue 2 - Autumn 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Building a winning spellbook for Mage Wars
A forgotten grimoire and its curse
The evolution from wargaming to role-playing
The hare and the hill giant
148439.description:
user summary
This is the second issue of Gygax Magazine

Gygax Magazine is the Quarterly Adventure Gaming Magazine which started publishing in the first quarter of 2013. This issue is 3 months late, and so instead of a Spring or Summer issue, it is an Autumn issue.

The magazine was founded by several veterans of the RPG industry along with Gary Gygax's two sons.

148440.name: Skylanders Island Quest Game
148440.description:
Get ready for an ultimate Skylanders adventure as you battle Kaos and his minions. Place one of the fighting-action lenticular cards into your mover base and start exploring the 6 different islands. Defeat villains in order to collect keys and charms, but watch out! If Kaos shows up, all active Skylanders lose some of their power.

Contents: 6 island game boards, 32 lenticular Skylanders cards, 34 reward tiles, 34 challenge tiles, 8 starter activation tokens, 4 keys, 4 card holder movers, game die, rules.

148441.name: Identity: The Board Game
148441.description:
From the box:

Play the hit NBC tv game show at home.

Match 12 complete strangers with their own identity as you try to collect the most money and win.

Contents: 100 stranger cards, 12 card stands, instructions and solutions booklet, wipe off money board, easel, wipe off pen and guessing pad.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
148442.description: In the card game nullern, a throwback to card games of yesteryear, players try to predict the number of tricks they'll take, suffering "Hupfer" — negative points — when incorrect.
148442.name: nullern

boardgamehonor: 2014 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2015 JUGuinho Best Children's Game Winner
148443.description: Talo, a game for children and families, contains a lot of wooden tiles with which to build, and in the end players want to be the first on top. As co-designer Johann Rüttinger states, "It's a very good game to learn mathematics without learning..."
148443.name: Talo

148444.name: Five Ancient Kingdoms Volume 1: Men and Mettle
148444.description:
From the introduction:
It is an Age of Wonders! BARICA is the greatest land in all the world and BAGDABHA its greatest city! Here, the common people mingle with wealthy merchants and sultans in disguise, while heroes and saints rub shoulders with magicians and thieves! All praise to almighty HALAH, God most high!

FIVE ANCIENT KINGDOMS is a set of rules for a fantasy adventure game. It is divided into three volumes: Men & Mettle, Magic & Monsters, and Dragon Master Secrets. You will need several six-­‐sided dice and at least one other person to play. Unlike some games, there is no board or playing pieces; instead, game play takes place in the minds and imaginations of the participants as they describe their actions and determine the events of the imaginary game world.

User comment:
This is the one volume in a three volume set for the core rules.

148445.name: Five Ancient Kingdoms Volume 2: Magic and Monsters
148445.description:
From the introduction:
The origin of magic is lost in the sands of time, but its power remains, jealously guarded and passed down from master to student over the years. Magical knowledge is often stored in writing: books and grimoires, scrolls and tablets. All magicians are taught to read magic’s ancient language, and most keep a spell book or collection of writings, storing those spells discovered, taught, or stolen. Illiterate magicians are limited to spells memorized.

User comment:
This is the second volume in a three volume set for the core rules.

148446.name: Five Ancient Kingdoms Volume 3: Dragon Master Secrets
148446.description:
From the introduction:
As the Dragon Master (DM) it is your responsibility to facilitate the game, describing the world to the players as their characters’ “five senses.” You determine the actions of non-­‐player characters (NPCs), both man and monster; you also act as referee and rules interpreter. By creating adventures and allowing the player characters free reign to interact with the setting, you help to create magnificent stories of fantastic adventure. While Book 1 provides information every player should know, and Book 2 details the supernatural elements of the Five Ancient Kingdoms (5AK), it is this volume which provides the additional rules you need to run the game as the DM.

User comment:
This is the third volume in a three volume set for the core rules.

148448.name: 300 Mile Race Game
148448.description: The 300 Mile Race Game is a board game which simulates a stock car race with 30 participants. The object of the game is to pick the winning car from among the 30 cars in the game. Dice are rolled against a sequence of tables to determine which cars get to advance around the track. The tables also have results which can cause cars to suffer pit stops, crashes, or mechanical failures. The first car around the track wins, along with the player who picked that car (if any).

148449.name: Sorcerer Island
148449.description:
From the introduction:
25 miles off the coast, perhaps half a day’s travel under sail with good winds, lies a dark outcropping of storm-­‐drenched stone – a black mountain of ominous rock rising from the sea, daring sailors to step ashore and face its danger. Old maps give it the name “Devil’s Point” and legends say the isle was once a peninsula joined to the mainland (till vengeful gods destroyed its bridge of stone in their rage). The locals, however, call it SORCERER ISLAND, and it is believed to be the final resting place of XUTHUS OF DELOSI, a wicked sorcerer who lived centuries before the coming of the Prophet.

148450.name: Endless Nightmare
148450.description:
You’re caught in an endless, ever shifting nightmare hunted by The Shadow – an ominous all devouring presence. You try to outrun it and avoid going insane from the horrors of the nightmare, but it’s just a matter of time until you succumb.

Mechanically Endless Nightmare is a simple push your luck, risk management where the player must strike a balance between spending actions on the threats and resources of the game while trying to run as long as possible before the inevitable defeat.

There are two modes of play: Basic and Active. The Basic Version is a normal board game while the Active version requires real life skills, such as being required to hold your breath while playing through a Nightmare about drowning. The Basic version provides 12 different nightmare scenes each with their own simple special rule based on the theme of the scene. Most plays will take the player through one to five of these scenes. The Active version replaces or changes 8 of the scenes for a total of 20 different nightmare scenes.

Endless Nightmare is an entry in the 2013 Solitaire Print and Play Contest, where it placed second in the No Assembly Required category and won its designer the Best New Designer category.

Endless Nightmare is free to print and play, and a single sheet of paper needs to be printed. Add in 11 small markers (one of which must be different than the others) and a six sided die. To play the Active Version another sheet of paper must be printed and 6 more markers and a stop watch (one is available on most phones) are needed.

148452.name: Blokus World Tour
148452.description:
User Summary

This is the 2008 PC version of the boardgame Blokus, implementing the rules and board for both Blokus and Blokus Duo. The game allows for play against one or more AI opponents (of varying strengths), against one or more human opponents, or for a puzzle mode.

148453.name: De Ramplassang
148453.description:
Players strive to become the surrogate of Luxembourg's national comic superhero: Superjhemp. To do so, they must fulfill missions and take control of Luxembourg's cantons by proving their knowledge about Luxembourg's history and present.

In this trivia game, every player draws a secret mission card at the start of the game. This tells the player which cantons (pairs of spaces on the map) have to be controlled by the player in order to win.

Players traverse the map from north to south. Every time they land on one space, a card from that space is drawn and a random trivia question is asked. If the player knows the answer, he can put a marker on the space. If both spaces from one canton are marked, the player controls that canton. It is possible for players to wrest control of a half or full canton away from a player controlling them.

148454.name: Die Biene Maja
148454.description:
Players try to gather Maja's friends together.

Every player has a board with eight characters depicting Maja's friends. Each character has two slots for a colored pin to place in. The winner is the first player to place a pin in all sixteen slots.

To place a pin, the current player spins the central spinner. There are spaces for the eight characters, Maja, and a lightning bolt. If Maja is the result, the player may place two pins in any slots. If the lightning bolt occurs, the player must remove two pins. If any of the eight characters are spun, the player places one pin on the character.

Players may also place a pawn near one spinner space to potentially be able to place two pins on the character, if it is spun.

148457.name: Myrunhall
148457.description:
from the back of the book

Myrunhall - is a province in northeastern Gyldraland. Here reigns Trodinar Thumion al Alan Tinos for a short time. His attempts to revive the country on the shores of Thalassion and to let the times of the Hundred Years war at sea behind are looked upon with benevolence by some, supported by few and hampered by others by intrigue and intentional sabotage.

Myrunhall - is the description of a manageable settings with the aim to fill a region with many details of life, but without making too many requirements and cuting short the manifold possibilities of Myranor. Apart from the region itself its history as well as all levels of society are presented to allow a varied game with many facets. For an easy start it also includes a variety of possible scenario ideas and three elaborated short adventures.

148458.name: Der Fluch des Blutsteins
148458.description:
from the back of the book

The heroes have entered the realm of Xo'Artal after the long and perilous journey in the first volume of the regional campaign Green Hell. In the city of Amakun they delve deep into the culture of its proud people who experience strange a mixture of a blood cult and the arts, crafts of war and deep spirituality. But the heroes are not here to relax! Porto Velvenya must be saved, and to achieve this, the heroes become part of a grand ceremony. Every few decades the residents of Amakun must prove that they are still worthy of the grace of their many luxurious gods. But this time the Xo'Artal are put on a really hard test - and the heroes with them.

The second part of the book describes the people of the Xo'Artal and the game rules to you need to play a Xo'Artal Warrior, a blood mage or blood priest. There is a description of the Xo'Artal-cities in general and particularly of Amakun, as well as new creatures of Uthuria.

148459.name: Rakshazar: Auf blutigen Pfaden
148459.description:
from the back of the book

Friends of land of Giants, after the Rakshazar: Buch der Helden, in which we have made ​​the continent of Rakshazar playable, here comes an adventure pack as an stress challenge for your heroes.

Not only the locals are mangled: In the two-part-scenario "gates in the ice" and "Ingerimms revenge" we serve you a trip that starts in Aventuria and leads to large parts of the land of Giants. If that should prove too hard, you can ease it out with "smaller" stuff: trolls who have subjugated some villages beyond the desert of spirits in our adventure, "The daughter of the warlord". Who likes quieter travels should take a little vacation in adventure "The eyes of Lath." Admire the majestic nature of perhaps the most hostile place on Dere and the megalomaniac monuments of the three-river-country.

Whoever has not got enough may be presented with the fulminant end of our menue: collected short adventures. These seven jewels are - more or less - "Rakshazar Forte", with a particularly high density of blood, sweat and tears.

There is only onw thing toe say from a safe distance: Good luck! (and do not say we did not warn you!)

148460.name: Schattenstädte
148460.description:
user description

Schattenstädte is the translation of Runner Havens with an added chapter on Hamburg in the shadows.


edition overview

Runner Havens was released in three different versions in Europe. All three add different city chapters to the ones on Seattle and Hong Kong included in the original:
Runner Havens (2006, fanpro US, 144 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong
Schattenstädte (2006, German translation by fanpro, 192 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg
Schattenstädte (Revised) (2010, German translation by Pegasus, 223 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg, Marseille
Capitales des ombres (2008, French translation by BBE) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Marseille

148461.name: Mutiny
148461.description:
The goal of Mutiny is to stay alive while eliminating your opponents. Keeping your allies safe is also a good idea. But... better them than you right? You’re a pirate after all!

Players are given role cards to determine their allegiance and who they will play as for the game. Players can be divided into 3 groups, Traitors, Loyal shipmates and the captain.

Traitors try to eliminate the captain, who is known by everyone, and the loyal mates while the shipmates try to defend the captain and kill all the traitors. The captain's goal is simply to stay alive, but since he's the only one oblivious to the other players loyalty, it can be harder than it looks.

The two main groups will then decide, one after the other, which meal they want to poison and once this is done the round can start. One after the other, players will switch their meals with one another. Once everyone did their action, everyone will reveal their meal card. Those who have been poisoned are removed from the game and those who survive continue to the next round.

This goes on until every traitors or mates has died or until the Captain dies.

148462.name: Tram: Spel
148462.description: Tram-Spel (Tram game) is about horsecars and was made in the early 1900's by Werner & Schumann, Berlin. It is typical roll and move board game. The first player who cross 63 stops, wins the game.

148463.name: Tage des Blutes
148463.description:
user summary

Tage des Blutes is a free adventure published for Lodland.

148464.name: Evasive Maneuvers
148464.description:
User Summary

In Evasive Maneuvers, the player controls a futuristic jet equipped with lasers and bombs. The jet must be navigated through scrolling levels at a constant rate, avoiding barriers, missiles, and mines, all without falling behind.
There are four scenarios: 1) Imperial City, 2)Infrastructure, 3) E.N.I.A.C. 9 and 4)Desert Valley

148465.name: Die LZS Morituri
148465.description:
user summary

Die LZS Morituri is a free adventure published for Lodland.

148466.name: Atlas Raider
148466.description:
Get ready to embark on an epic quest for lost treasure in CrayonPixel's mixed-genre, comic-book style board game, Atlas Raider​! Battle dangerous beasts, hurdle perilous pitfalls, and bring all your friends along in this adventure of a lifetime. Only you can harness the power of the Skull Atlas and discover the greatest hidden treasures of the world!

Source: The Developer Website.

---

User Summary

In Atlas Raider, the game board is a grid of squares the must be unlocked with the character rolling a die that is modified by character stats and the presence of friends and equipment. Players aim to locate and use relics to defeat monsters and further the storyline.

148467.name: Miami Vice: the Game
148467.description:
From the box

Rogue cops and players become one in the dangerous universe of Miami Vice. Set in todays Miami, Miami Vice: The Game lets you go deep undercover as narc officers Sonny Crockett and Ricardo Tubbs.

148468.name: Army of Two: The 40th Day (PSP)
148468.description:
From the box
All new PSP game play - Intense arcade action brings you a completely unique experience.

148470.name: The Amazing Spider-Man vs. The Kingpin
148470.description:
From the back of the box:

SNARE THE KINGPIN!
Enter a vicious web of danger and disaster! The Kingpin of Crime frames Spider-Man for planting a bomb in New York; and Spidey’s only hope is to find keys to the bomb’s location before it explodes. Help Spider-Man stick it to the Kingpin and his horde of vicious assassins along the way.

ORIGINAL 3-D ANIMATIONS! Incredible Spider-Man sequences and up-to-the-minute caper reports!

TAKE AIM WITH SPIDEY’S GADGETS! Shoot webs! Stick to walls and ceilings! And swing from skyscrapers!

DANGEROUS CRIMINALS! Enter hand-to-hand combat with Dr. Octopus! Put the Sandman to sleep! Use dazzling acrobatics to take on the Lizard, Hobgoblin & Venom. Dodge Electro’s amped-up charge! Don’t be fooled by the new trickery of Mysterio and the villainy of the Vulture.

CD-QUALITY MUSIC & AUDIO! Featuring a new original hit from Eric Martin of Mr Big! Pump it up!

148471.description:
Vietnam Solitaire Special Edition is an expanded edition of the original Vietnam Solitaire that contains both the original game (with all new artwork) and a reimplementation by Steve Kling with expanded rules, new scenarios, and new counters. While primarily a solitaire game, the special edition also contains optional two player rules.

In the Special Edition, the player controls US and South Vietnamese forces and must battle the Vietcong and North Vietnamese Army to control as many regions of Vietnam as possible. The game is played by deploying US and South Vietnamese forces, napalm, and air units on a map of Vietnam. The AI (or an optional second player) controls the North Vietnamese forces through movement and attack rules.

Victory is determined by controlling at least three regions of Vietnam for a majority of the game. Unlike in the original game, the eventual victory of the North Vietnamese is not a foregone conclusion.

The Special Edition contains new types of units, a greater variety of of combat points, and two new scenarios - "Tet 1968" and "Fall of South Vietnam".
148471.name: Vietnam Solitaire Special Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! Episode 49: 2013 in review

148472.name: The Take
148472.description:
The Take is about crooked cops taking money. It is played over the course of several rounds. Each round, each player takes a bill(card) worth between 1 and 5 thousand dollars. In the second half of the game each player gets an opportunity to take an action after all players have taken their money for the round.

There are three ways to win the game:

If the deck of cards runs out, the player with the most money wins at the end of the final round.
If a player correctly accuses a player of having the most money,the accuser immediately wins.
If a player correctly accuses another player of having the least money, the player with the most money wins.




There are 4 basic actions that players can take by spending money from their hand.

Stakeout: Adjust turn order.
Audit: Look at another player's cards.
Accuse: Accuse a player of having the most or least money.
Defame: Block a player from taking an action.

148473.name: Hitler Turns East
148473.description:
(from the ATO website "Black Swans" section)
Against the Odds broke new ground with the 2010 Annual. Four Roads to Moscow included four different, complete games from four top designers, each one taking their own approach to cover Barbarossa. There have been “quad games” before, but never like this.

While many people are thrilled to get all four, we figured a few folks might have a favored designer and only want that game. We aim to please. So, if you want to try just one or two of the “Four Roads,” the option is here.

Hitler Turns East by Ted Raicer is a classic-style, hex-and-counter wargame that uses chit-pull to keep things fluid. Hitler Turns East focuses on the difficulties of armies cooperating with each other, either for political or personal reasons (and Barbarossa saw lots on both sides).

The new printing of Hitler Turns East comes with 144 updated die-cut 9/16" counters, and a 17" x 22" full color map, plus updated rules and charts.

148474.name: Boot & Spiele
148474.description:
Boot & Spiele is a pdf adventure for Lodland.
It includes additional rules for a Lodland-themed card game.

148488.name: LodlanD Quarterly – RDL-Wahl-Special I
148488.description: First special edition on in-game elections.

148489.name: LodlanD Quarterly – RDL-Wahl-Special II
148489.description: Second special edition on in-game elections.

148490.name: LodlanD Quarterly – RDL-Wahl-Special III
148490.description: Third special edition on in-game elections.

148491.description:
Back to school! Here comes the annual retreat for monsters from all hierarchies to sharpen their skills after playing bad guys in a variety of board games for the past year. The most anticipated event, of course, is the legendary lunchtime battle! No one wants to be sent off on an errand to buy lunch for all the others, so brace yourself and fight for your monster's dignity!

In Monster College: Lunchtime Battle, each player chooses one monster from his hand to join the "counting circle" each turn. Based on the die roll and a counting process, 1-3 unfortunate monsters are fingered to buy lunch for others (earning minus points along the way for the corresponding players) — but these candidate monsters are so childish that in later turns they'll use their special abilities to bend the counting rules in their favor. In the end, the player whose collected candidate monsters show the most overall "hunger" loses the game and must go buy lunch (or whatever else they agreed to before the game) for everyone else!

一年一度的進修日又到了，平時在各大遊戲扮演稱職壞蛋的魔物們再度回到校園，認真複習各種魔物必修技能。好不容易撐過早上的課程，魔物們最期待的午餐時間終於到了！今年究竟是哪個班級的魔物要當跑腿小弟去幫大家買便當呢？這場年度便當大戰即將揭開序幕！
148491.name: Monster College: Lunchtime Battle

148492.description:
In Dystopian: the manhunt, one to four players assume the role of special agents of the Dystopia Police Department (called Sector 9), with the goal of investigating a murder case, finding the criminal, among four suspects and, eventually, catching him, it or her, before he gets away.
The agents will move around the megalopolis of Dystopia, investigating the numerous locations (distributed among districts and suburbs) meeting people, talking to them, gaining and finding hints and leads that make the investigation progress, bringing them closer and closer to the murderer.
Dystopia is a City controlled by two rival Corporations (Varcom and Infracorp), that are in the business of AI-Roids: artificially intelligent robots that live with the humans.
Dystopia features a plethora of many different locations, where the players will have to conduct their investigation.

Dystopian: the manhunt features the following mechanics: worker placement, variable player powers, action selection, network building, cooperative/solitaire play, press your luck.

The players will have to roll dice, and allocate them on their agent's sheet to gain these resources:
1) warrants: to enter a location
2) attack: to respond to an attack from an encounter
3) evade: to hide from an attack from an encounter
4) interact: to interact with encounters or locations
5) analyze: to analyze hints and gain evidence about who committed the crime

Such resources will be used to deal with encounters the players will meet around the city, to advance their agent's abilities, ultimately, to catch the suspect who is found guilty.

The game is divided in 2 stages: the first is the Search, where players have to discovered who, among the 4 suspects, committed the crime; and the second, the Chase, where the suspect tries to hide in Dystopia, and it's up to the agents to seize him (it or her).
148492.name: Dystopian: the manhunt

148493.name: Jaguar Controller
148493.description:
User Summary
